FuncDef:
The service-location command binds a service-location backup group to a service-instance-group instance group.
The undo service-location command removes the binding between a service-location backup group and a service-instance-group instance group.
By default, a service-location backup group is bound to no service-instance-group instance group.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the ID of a service-location backup group.
On a VSUF-80/VSUF-160/VSUI-160-E, the value is an integer ranging from 1 to 255.
On an LPUF-51-E/LPUI-51-E/LPUI-51-S, the value is an integer ranging from 1 to 16.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
To bind a service-location backup group to a service-instance-group instance group, run the service-location command. A NAT instance on a service board must be bound to a service-location backup group, and the backup group must be bound to a service-instance-group instance group, so that NAT traffic can be properly directed to the service board.
Prerequisites
A service-location backup group has been configured.
